subject: AI
title: AI for Text Generation
description: How models write paragraphs from a prompt.

hook.text: You type three words and GPT writes a whole essay. It reads like a human wrote it. But did the model 'understand' anything?

buildup.text: Text generation models predict the next word, over and over. Given 'The cat sat on the,' the model assigns probabilities to every possible next word and picks one.

discovery.text: This simple mechanism ‚Äî next token prediction ‚Äî trained on enough text produces coherent paragraphs, code, poetry, and dialogue. Scale turned a simple idea into something uncanny.

twist.text: The model doesn't know if what it writes is true. It produces plausible text, not verified facts. Fluent bullshit is still bullshit.

climax.text: Use generated text as a first draft, not a final answer. Verify facts, check logic, and edit for your voice. The model is a writing accelerator, not a source of truth.

punchline.text: It writes brilliantly. It also makes things up brilliantly. You must tell the difference.

quiz.question: How do text generation models produce output?
options: By retrieving text from a database
By predicting the next token repeatedly
By translating from a hidden language
By copying from training examples verbatim
